alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marshall; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 2:27AM CST until January 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Knox, Stark and Marshall Counties. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow Friday evening and overnight could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerous conditions could impact this evening`s commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will transition to rain or a rain snow mix this morning, then switch back to snow by mid afternoon as colder air and strong winds move in. Near blizzard-like conditions are possible this afternoon into Saturday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com
